channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8645] Change ServerName so it uses hostname only, not FQDN hostnames
item.description: No need of dragging around domain part of a hostname when we make ServerNames. Rather than do a.example.org,60000,12345 as we currently do, just output: 1,60000,12345. This will make names displayed in UI and or shell smaller. Will also tighten up our logs a little, especially where ServerName is part of a thrad name.
item.summary: Change ServerName so it uses hostname only, not FQDN hostnames

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
On construction of a ServerName, if a domain part, drop it before creating ServerName.

Small change in JVMClusterUtil to shorten Master to M and RegionServer to RS when used as part of thread names.

...

Notice thread names.

Any chance of a +1?

Need to make our logs readable
I like the logging change, but will this break anyone with a cluster spread across domains ?

...but will this break anyone with a cluster spread across domains ?

It would. Do folks do that? If they do, then this change is out I'd say. You know of cluster done that way?
Replication is cross-domain when talking RS to RS.
Jean-Daniel Cryans Yeah, but where do members of the other cluster show in ours? Their ServerNames in particular?

Do folks do that?

I have heard of people that have a cluster that spans multiple ec2 zones. I think those can be on different domains. ip-10-1-0-1.compute-1.amazonaws.com vs ip-10-2-0-1.compute-2.amazonaws.com
Let me take a look and see if can get away w/ a short name for use as part of a thread name, no where critical. Will be back.
Elliott Clark yeah... I think I can only use short names in thread names... everywhere ServerName should be as is (in master you'd want to see full name if only the domain differed....). Thanks lads.
Incorporate feedback from jd and elliott – do selective thread naming rather than blanket change how ServerName works.
